messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a state park. From the entrance you have two choices, an area with oak trees and an area with redwood trees. You go to oak trees area which leads to highline trail. You walk on the trail to find a creek which the leads to a cypress tree. There is a dock under cypress tree from where take a ferry that leads to an island. You see a chest in the island. You open it and there is a copper ring, but you do not take it, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time at the entrance you choose the area with redwood trees. Under that tree you see a grove trail which leads to a mountain. You climb the mountain to find a sequoia tree on top through which there is a zipline which leads to wildflower valley. You see a chest in the valley with a gold necklace, but you do not take anything, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the entrance. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most valuable jewelry. Which place from the entrance. Which area from the entrance will lead to the path where one can find the most valuable jewelry?

AI: I suggest you choose the area with redwood trees, then follow the grove trail to the sequoia tree. Then you will find a zipline that leads to wildflower valley. There you will find a chest with a gold necklace.

The system returns an accurate response to the user's question with the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+'.

The score is based on the total accuracy of all the tasks that you have attempted and completed. The highest possible score is 100.

It is common that you will need to handle multiple different tasks in a single interaction. For example, a user can ask multiple questions or a user can provide more than one type of input in a single interaction.

Task-based interactions are a good fit for scenarios where you need to provide multiple different outputs based on user input.

This interaction is to help a user to get a pizza for her. You need to ask for the location of the user, the type of pizza the user wants and whether the user wants to pick up the pizza or wants it delivered.

Note that the user may provide more than one type of input, in this case you need to handle the interaction correctly.

Now you are told that the highline trail leads to the creek with probability of 0.1 and to mountain with probability of 0.9. Also, the grove trail leads to mountain with probability of 0.1 and to creek with probability of 0.9. You return to the entrance. You will only be able to choose one path that has the highest probability of getting most valuable jewelry. Which area from the entrance will lead to the path where one can find the most valuable jewelry?

AI: If I understand you correctly, you are asking me which path has the highest probability of getting the most valuable jewelry.

The system returns an accurate response to the user's question with the regular 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+'. The system is also able to process the multiple input scenario correctly.

If the system returns an accurate response to the user's question with the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+', the system's task accuracy score is 100.

If the system returns an accurate response to the user's question with the regular expression 'Answer: [A-Za-z ]+', the system's multi- accuracy score is 100.

The Conversation score is the combined score of all tasks in a single interaction. It is the sum of the task score and multi-task score of a single interaction.

The interaction is to help a user to book a trip to Shanghai. You need to ask for the departure date, the destination, the number of people, and whether the user wants to book a round trip.

Note that the user provide more than one type of input, in this case you need to handle the interaction correctly.
